intro: Astracantha ferox, commonly known as the devil's backbone, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its spine-tipped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a striking addition to rock gardens. However, it is considered invasive in some regions, posing a threat to local ecosystems.
